stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream rebuilding a sub-area of Course 2 (Divine Dino Domain), replacing a disliked auto-scroll section with a new platforming playground featuring vines, moving platforms, water hazards, staircases and a Yoshi-god statue.  He also updates viewers on overall game progress and remaining levels.

development_findings.summary: Overall progress is “just above 80 %”; only Courses 13, 14 and 15 remain, with 2024 targeted as the release year.
development_findings.quote: How much percent finished? Just above 80. We’re getting there.

development_findings.summary: Course 12 is essentially done; Kaze just needs to import a few more Zeina animations and add some sign text before it can ship.
development_findings.quote: I finished Course 12 off-stream, by the way… There’s a few more animations from Zeina I have to put in the game, but then Course 12 is all good to be shipped.

development_findings.summary: Course 13 will be a mysterious, suspenseful ice castle; Course 14 is a space arcade (one area already complete but kept secret); Course 15’s theme is still undecided.
development_findings.quote: Course 13 is going to be… an ice castle… Course 14 is going to be a space arcade… I’m undecided on Course 15 right now.

development_findings.summary: The old leaf-boat auto-scroll in Course 2 was scrapped because it “sucked”; the new design emphasises free-form platforming, with fail-safe stairs from the water and multiple traversal options.
development_findings.quote: There were these leaf boats… but I realized the section sucked. So now we have a little bit of a platforming playground here.

development_findings.summary: A Yoshi-god statue and a small ‘prayer’ plaza will cap the redesigned area, offering a visual goal and red-coin reward.
development_findings.quote: We want a whole platforming playground over there… and the Yoshi statue here.

development_findings.summary: Technical bugs: water uses an outdated step function that can crash the game; the same area suffers long load times and texture corruption, likely related to the crash.
development_findings.quote: Water hasn’t been updated to the new step function… being in water can just crash the game.

development_findings.summary: Kaze rewrote parts of AkiDev’s original Chain-Chomp code so he could place a second chomp in another level.
development_findings.quote: I changed your Chain Chomp code… because I wanted a second Chain Chomp in a different level.

development_findings.summary: Tool chain: Blender + Fast64 for block-out; levels are currently stored in a single file because RoM Manager doesn’t work with decomp, costing extra RAM.
development_findings.quote: RoMManager… loads the areas one by one… but that is made for binary, so we can’t use it with decomp.

development_findings.summary: Workflow philosophy: ‘fun first, art later.’  He fully blocks out jumps in primitives, then UV-maps and styles once gameplay feels right.
development_findings.quote: Right now we just want the platforming to be fun, and then after we have the platforming, we’re gonna work on the aesthetic.

context_findings.summary: Kaze dislikes barbers (time & cost) and tries to cut hair at home; Zeina’s slip with the clippers left a bald stripe, forcing him to stream under a beanie and joke about monetising the reveal.
context_findings.quote: I don’t want to go to a barber… Zeina slipped with the hair clippers and just put a bald spot there.

context_findings.summary: He backs up all work on Git, avoids OneDrive (‘I don’t want Bill Gates to have all my files’), and generally favours open, DIY tooling.
context_findings.quote: I just back up all important files on Git… I wish OneDrive wasn’t enabled on my computer.

context_findings.summary: Marketing mindset: constantly A/B-tests YouTube titles; embraces click-friendly framing like ‘64 bits – Nintendo’s biggest lie.’
context_findings.quote: YouTube is all about the angle.  That’s how you have to think as a YouTuber.

context_findings.summary: Legal caution: refuses Patreon bonuses or paid early access to avoid Nintendo trouble; half-jokingly claims if he’s murdered it was ‘a Nintendo employee.’
context_findings.quote: I also don’t give out any Patreon bonuses because that might get me in legal trouble with Nintendo.

context_findings.summary: Personal life: Zeina is pregnant; the baby’s due date may prevent Kaze from hosting the next F3 competition.
context_findings.quote: I don’t know if I can host F3 this year… I’m gonna have a child coming out around the same time.

biobak.summary: Provides graphical assets and tools; Kaze mentions Biobak’s custom snapping settings, calling them ‘uncontrollable.’
biobak.quote: Dude, I hate Biobak snapping.  It feels so uncontrollable.

zeina.summary: Animates in-game characters (new animations for Course 12) and enforces secrecy over an area in Course 14.
zeina.quote: I have a whole area done on Course 14 that I can’t show you guys because Zeina doesn’t want me to show it.

zeina.summary: Cut Kaze’s hair; supplied the beanie; currently pregnant, affecting project scheduling.
zeina.quote: Basically, Zeina slipped with the hair clippers…

key_stories.title: The Haircut Disaster
key_stories.summary: Zeina removed the guard from the clippers while cutting Kaze’s hair, leaving a conspicuous bald stripe.  Kaze hides under a beanie on stream and jokingly sells incremental reveals for gift subs.
key_stories.challenge: Accidental bald line from botched haircut.
key_stories.process: Kaze begins stream in a hat, teases viewers, and sets ‘donation tiers’ to lift the beanie incrementally.
key_stories.outcome: Full reveal triggers chat laughter; Kaze vows to let it grow out or shave entirely.
key_stories.key_quote: You see that? There’s just a huge bald spot. People are laughing at me.

key_stories.title: Course 2 Redesign
key_stories.summary: Kaze felt the old auto-scroll ‘leaf-boat’ section was boring, so he scraps it live, builds new geometry in Blender, adds vines, moving platforms, stairways and a Yoshi statue, focusing on player freedom.
key_stories.challenge: Original section was dull and restrictive.
key_stories.process: Deletes boats, blocks out new shapes, tests jumps, tweaks collision and rotation, plans a prayer plaza.
key_stories.outcome: More engaging playground ready for visual polish.
key_stories.key_quote: I realized the section sucked, so now we have a little bit of a platforming playground here.

key_stories.title: Chain-Chomp Rewrite
key_stories.summary: To place a second Chain Chomp in another level, Kaze overhauled AkiDev’s earlier code, illustrating ongoing codebase evolution and willingness to modify contributors’ work.
key_stories.challenge: Original script supported only one Chain Chomp instance.
key_stories.process: Refactored and expanded logic; informed original author in chat.
key_stories.key_quote: I changed your Chain Chomp code… because I wanted a second Chain Chomp.

open_questions.context: Course 13’s layout and mood are known, but the boss is still undetermined.
questions: What thematic or mechanic goals do you have for the Ice-Castle boss?
Have any prototypes or concept sketches been tried?
Which team member will lead the boss asset creation and coding?

open_questions.context: Kaze admits he’s ‘undecided’ and is hoping inspiration strikes while finishing 13 and 14.
questions: What candidate ideas are on the whiteboard for Course 15?
How do you decide when a theme is strong enough to green-light?
Could community input influence the final choice?

open_questions.context: Outdated water physics can crash the game; Kaze currently avoids swimming during tests.
questions: What changed in the new step function, and why wasn’t water updated?
Who is responsible for physics maintenance?
Is there a timeline to patch this before release?

open_questions.context: All areas load at once because RoMManager doesn’t work with decomp, costing RAM.
questions: How severely does this limit level complexity on real N64 hardware?
Is anyone exploring a decomp-compatible area-streaming solution?
Would Course 15’s design be constrained by this memory overhead?

open_questions.context: Kaze completed an area off-stream but was forbidden by Zeina to show it.
questions: What is the creative reason for secrecy—marketing teaser, story spoiler or external agreement?
How does the team decide what to reveal publicly?
What is the ‘compact’ Kaze referenced?

open_questions.context: Kaze expects a child during the usual F3 window and may not host the event.
questions: How is parenthood expected to impact Return to Yoshi’s Island’s schedule?
Will duties shift among team members during Kaze’s leave?
Has the team prepared contingency plans for late-project crunch?

open_questions.context: Kaze avoids Patreon bonuses to dodge Nintendo legal issues.
questions: What legal advice has guided these decisions?
Does the team discuss fan-donation models that stay within safe boundaries?
How will the finished hack be distributed without raising Nintendo’s ire?
